meanings.definition: The excrement of animals, especially cattle or horses.
meanings.sent1: The farm was covered in tae after the cows grazed all day.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to clean up the tae from the barnyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog rolled around in the tae and then ran into the house.
meanings.sent4: The tae in the field was a reminder of the animals that roamed there.
meanings.sent5: The smell of tae filled the air on the farm.

meanings.definition: To pull or drag with great effort or force.
meanings.sent1: The workers had to tae the heavy cart up the hill.
meanings.sent2: She had to tae the suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to tae their friend on the sled down the snowy hill.
meanings.sent4: He had to tae himself out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The team had to tae the boat through the rough waters.

meanings.definition: A Scottish variant of the word 'toe'.
meanings.sent1: She stubbed her tae on the corner of the table.
meanings.sent2: He painted his toenails to match his tae.
meanings.sent3: The little girl giggled when her brother tickled her tae.
meanings.sent4: The dancer pointed her tae gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The sand felt warm between her tae as she walked along the beach.
